subject: Re: Displaying the results of parameterized JUnit 4 tests in Eclipse
msgSnippet: Hi, ... Yes, they are annotated as follows: @RunWith(Parameterized.class) As far as I know in JUnit 3 you could customize what to display in the JUnit view of
messageBody:
Hi,

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "James Abley" <james.abley@...> wrote:
> That seems like a nice feature request. Are the test classes
> annotated to run with the parameterized runner?

Yes, they are annotated as follows:
@RunWith(Parameterized.class)

As far as I know in JUnit 3 you could customize what to display in
the JUnit view of Eclipse by overriding the getName() method of the
TestCase. Is there any similar solution for that in JUnit 4?

>> 2.) Is there a way to display the Standard Output/Error
>> separately per each test run?
>
> Can you explain a bit more about why you would want that?
>
> Cheers,
>
> James

When you run more then one JUnit test cases (or a parameterized test)
from Eclipse, by default you get only one Console view where all
the Standard Output/Error messages of all the executed tests are
displayed in bulk.
I mean you cannot determine which message was output by which test
case.

The problem is the same even if you execute your JUnit tests from Ant
and generate a report. In the report you will have only
the "System.out" and one "System.err" links for the entire test run
and not one per each test case.

However, I would be interested in a solution that captures
the "System.out" of my "testMethod[1]" separately from
the "System.out" of my "testMethod[2]".

Best regards,
Tibor
